greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A069359(A276086(n)), where A276086 converts the primorial base expansion of n into its prime product form and A069359(n) = n * Sum_{p|n} 1/p where p are primes dividing n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2310
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 0..32768
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
program: PARI) A329029(n) = { my(s=0, m=1, p=2, e); while(n, e = (n%p); if(e, m *= (p^e); s += (1/p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (s*m); };
A276086(n) = { my(m=1, p=2); while(n, m *= (p^(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m); };
xref: Coincides with A327860 on the positions given by A276156.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 07 2019
